result.execSummary:
The defendant Connie L. Hutcheson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Connie L. Hutcheson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Connie L. Hutcheson was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  PD - Terry Rose.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Discharged from probation on 4/23/16
Discharge reg on 4/23/16

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Agent McConville present.  Court admonishes deft about her non-compliance with probation conditions; i.e. substance/alcohol abuse.  Discussion ensues re: financial obligations.  Agent reports deft just obtained employment on 2/19/16.  Deft reports she should be able to start paying on her financial obligations.  Commencing 3/18/16, the deft is ordered to pay $50 every other Friday to DOC.  If deft misses a payment, the Agent shall notify the court the following Monday and the court will schedule a review hrg.
Deft's probation is extended for 6 months, from current discharge date or until all court olbigations are completed.
Review hearing at 02-26-2016 09:00 am

deft placed on probation

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 18mos.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Terry Rose.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Counts 1 and 3 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 2 - On or near a park enhancer is dropped at request of the State.  Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 10/23/14 at 3:00.  Bond continued.
FPT moved to 9/11/14 @ 2:45pm due to jury trial; attys notified via email
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Mutual request for an adjournment.  FPT set for 9/9/14 @ 2pm, JT 9/29/14 @ 9am

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:42am-  Matter heard w/ co-defendant's case.  Attorney Rose is in another court.  Court will reschedule the matter w/ DE's counsel.
10:29am-  Attorney T. Rose appeared in court.  DE's appearance waived.  Attorney Rose does not believe this matter would resolve.  Parties discussed off the record the DE's motion re: discovery - co-defendant's statement was not received.  Court adjourns matter to August 13, 2014 at 09:30 am.  Bond continued.
Notice of Assignment of Judge was returned for Connie L. Hutcheson.  Attempted, not known.  Unable to forward.
